match-highlighter.js
¶

Define match-highlighter commands. Depends on searchcursor.js Use by attaching the following function call to the cursorActivity event: myCodeMirror.matchHighlight(minChars); And including a special span.CodeMirror-matchhighlight css class (also optionally a separate one for .CodeMirror-focused -- see demo matchhighlighter.html)

 
(function() {
  var DEFAULT_MIN_CHARS = 2;
  
  function MatchHighlightState() {
  this.marked = [];
  }
  function getMatchHighlightState(cm) {
  return cm._matchHighlightState || (cm._matchHighlightState = new MatchHighlightState());
  }
  
  function clearMarks(cm) {
  var state = getMatchHighlightState(cm);
  for (var i = 0; i < state.marked.length; ++i)
    state.marked[i].clear();
  state.marked = [];
  }
  
  function markDocument(cm, className, minChars) {
    clearMarks(cm);
  minChars = (typeof minChars !== 'undefined' ? minChars : DEFAULT_MIN_CHARS);
  if (cm.somethingSelected() && cm.getSelection().replace(/^\s+|\s+$/g, "").length >= minChars) {
    var state = getMatchHighlightState(cm);
    var query = cm.getSelection();
    cm.operation(function() {
      if (cm.lineCount() < 2000) { // This is too expensive on big documents.
        for (var cursor = cm.getSearchCursor(query); cursor.findNext();) {

Only apply matchhighlight to the matches other than the one actually selected

 
        if (cursor.from().line !== cm.getCursor(true).line ||
                                    cursor.from().ch !== cm.getCursor(true).ch)
          state.marked.push(cm.markText(cursor.from(), cursor.to(),
                                                                      {className: className}));
        }
      }
      });
  }
  }

  CodeMirror.defineExtension("matchHighlight", function(className, minChars) {
    markDocument(this, className, minChars);
  });
})();
